result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan P Heil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Info (Misd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.

Compliance with Sex Offender Registry.
Follow through with any treatment and/or couseling recommended by the agent.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions, including elder care for elderly parents.
Apply 27 days sentence credit.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jim Fitzgerald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonathan P Heil in court, in custody, with attorney Mark A. Kent.   

State presented their sentencing arguments.

Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:

27 Days Credit.

Any outstanding costs/fines are to be converted to a civil judgment.

Order Denying - Defense Motion for Modification of Sentence or Modification of Probation Rules.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jim Fitzgerald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonathan P Heil in court, in custody, with attorney Mark A. Kent.    
Motion filed by the defense - Modification of Sentence or Modification of Probation Rules.

Atty. Kent presented Modification of Sentence arguments to the court.
State is objecting no legal basis for a modification of sentencing and presented arguments.
Atty. Kent presented response arguments.


Court is satisfied that until we get the Revocation Order and Warrant from D.O.C. the court can not proceed with a sentencing after revocation.
Court denies the Defense Motion for Sentence Modification - No legal basis for a Modification of Sentence of Probation Rules.
Further reasons placed on the record.
Court signed order denying.

Order Denying - Defense Motion to Dismiss.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 12/14/16.
Hearing on January 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonathan P Heil in court with attorney Mark A. Kent.  
Motion filed by the defense - To Dismiss (Vague and Over Broad).

Atty. Kent presented arguments to the court.
State presented arguments to the court.
Response presented.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the Defendant was sufficiently put on notice of what he didn't do.
Court also finds the complaint sufficiently indicates the two specific sites he failed to report as required by the Sex Offender Registry.
Therefore, Court denies the defense motion to dismiss.
Court signed order denying.
All parties received a copy of the signed order in court.

Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney David John Behm appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mark A. Kent appeared by phone means for Defendant Jonathan P Heil.
Oral Ruling on:
Defense Motion for Return of Seized Property and Suppression of the Seizure.


Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the search warrant is sufficient and there is no basis to suppress.
Therefore, Court Denies the Defense Motion for Suppression of the Seizure.

As for the request for return of property:
Court can not find any relevance for the seizure of the property as it relates to the Sex Registry Violation.
Next court date will allow for the state and defense to work out return of some property.
If property not returned by the next court date, court will require the state to provide additional information as to why the seizure of this property is relevant.
  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
List of returned items, received and filed in court by Atty. Kent.

Motion filed by Defense - To Suppress and Return of Property.

Atty. Kent presented arguments to the court (35 items taken).
State presented statements to the court (analysis of computers will not be completed until end of July).
Response presented.

Search warrant doesn't include a copy of all the items seized (that list needs to be tracked down).

The Motion to Suppress is premature at this point.
Only issue the court needs to address is the return of property.
Matter put over for an oral ruling.
Court will not require the defendant's appearance for the next court date or parties may appear by phone.  Oral ruling scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
